intro: Vallesia sinaloensis, commonly known as the Sinaloa vallesia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Valerianaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, small flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a strong, aromatic scent. Vallesia sinaloensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
